clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Music on Quality of Life in Fibromyalgia Patients
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Therapeutic Use of Music on Quality of Life in Fibromyalgia Patients: a Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: This study's aim was to determine the effect of music therapy on symptoms and functions in patients with fibromyalgia syndrome (FMS).

detailed_description.textblock: This study's aim was to determine the effect of music therapy on symptoms and functions in patients with fibromyalgia syndrome (FMS). Women diagnosed with FMS for at least 6 months included in the study. 16 patients were in the music treatment group and 51 patients were in the control group. Patients in music treatment group were given a music CD which includes nature sounds recommended by the Turkish Psychological Association. The patients were evaluated with Fibromyalgia Impact Questionnaire (FIQ) before and after the treatment.

primary_outcome.description: Changes in Fibromyalgia Impact Questionnaire, the total score is between 0-100. Higher total scores indicate higher disability

arm_group.description: Music therapy lasted 30 minutes every day for a total of 20 days.

intervention.description: music includes nature sounds recommended by the Turkish Psychological Association

study_pop.textblock: Patients with fibromyalgia, admitted to polyclinics

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Female patients over the age of 18
- Being diagnosed as FMS according to 2010 American College of Rheumatology (ACR) criteria for FMS
- Having the diagnosis of FMS at least six months
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with hearing problems, pregnancy, another accompanying central sensitization syndrome or schizophrenia
- Patients with psychiatric illness
- Patients whose pharmacological treatment for FMS changed within the last three months
- Patients without a listening device
- Patients who do not have a cognitive level to answer the questions in the scale
